reviewText: I was so young when I saw the boys in the 90's superbowls and I wanted to go back and watch the games over gain. This set was perfect for that and it really does a nice job of laying out the season and the  game highlights. It is really cool to see the images that I vaguely remember from my youth. How bout them Cowboys?! Emmitt Smith is still the man
summary: Really Cool Stuff for a Cowboys Fan!
Title: NFL Super Bowl Collection - Dallas Cowboys

reviewText: This is a DVD which covers the 5 NFL championships of perhaps the NFL's most storied franchise:  the Dallas Cowboys.  It discusses their Superbowl victories in 1971, 1977, 1992, 1993 & 1995.  Each Superbowl time capsule is broken down into 2 segments.  The first is an overview of the entire season from a fan's perspective.  There is a discussion of the trends of the league, the rising stars, teams on their way up & the teams that thought they were contenders only to find out they were actually pretenders.The second segment covers the Superbowl itself & reveals all of the overriding factors which led the Cowboys to victory.  Whether it be the Dallas running game which powered the '71 Cowboys or the relentless defense of the '77 & '92 teams, all relevant aspects of the games are discussed.  Not surprisingly, the sound, picture and production value of the time capsules get much improved when we get to the '92 season.The special features on Disc #1 have bit pieces on Duane Thomas, Bob Lilly, Roger Staubach & the two venerable Dallas safeties, Cliff "crash" Harris and Charlie Waters.  On Disc #2 the special features cover Jimmy Johnson, Michael Irvin, Emmitt Smith & Larry Brown.The promo for this DVD is a bit mis-leading as it says "NFL Super Bowl Collection - Dallas Cowboys by Troy Aikman, Emmitt Smith."  In fact, the only time we hear from Aikman is during the bit pieces on Irvin & Smith, and the only time we hear from Smith is during his own biographical piece.  So, those who believe these 2 will be the hosts of the dual DVDs are apt to be disappointed.Also, of the personas covered, Larry Brown is a big-time reach.  Granted, the Cowboy faithful are thankful for his performance during Super Bowl XXX.  However, he was otherwise a marginal player @ best.  After that year, the Raiders signed him to a contract that was silly-big & his career promptly fizzled out.  There are a great many bigger names in the Cowboy pantheon whom they could have done a bio on instead of Brown (Tom Landry, Tony Dorsett & Troy Aikman, to name a few!).  Oh, well.  At LEAST they didn't do a bio on Jerry Jones.  It's his arrogance,  ineptitude & meddling that have impeded the franchise ever since he drove Jimmy out of town!If you are a Cowboys fan, then this DVD set belongs in your collection.  If you're not a Cowboys fan, then you're most likely not reading this review in the 1st place.  Hence, IF you've read all of what I have to say, then most likely you will enjoy having this DVD!  NFL historian Steve Sabol has put together a great many works from the NFL archives. This one can be added to the list of his accomplishments.
Title: NFL Super Bowl Collection - Dallas Cowboys

reviewText: I am very disappointed in the DVDs I purchased. 15 different supposed super bowl collection series DVDs. A series in which a different super bowl was what the cover depicts for each team. THE SUPER BOWL CHAMPIONS then it gives the number of the super bowl in roman numerals. Other have Americans game the SUPER BOWL CHAMPIONSHIP and shows the ring on the cover. Did I miss something? Would that mean the game is what the DVD is about?  Wrong the only super bowls I have received in their eternity are the two Broncos' super bowls of the Super Bowl XXXII and Super Bowl XXXIII that came along with the 1977 AFC Championship Game in a three set entitled the Broncos 3 greatest games. Said nothing about super bowl games. The only reason I knew the super bowl games were included was I had researched it on another website what I should have done for these. All very misleading. Now I have to go through the hassle of returning 13 DVD. Very disappointed.NFL Super Bowl Collection: Dallas Cowboys
Title: NFL Super Bowl Collection - Dallas Cowboys

reviewText: Bought this for my husband, the avid Cowboy fan and would recommend for all Cowboy fans
Title: NFL Super Bowl Collection - Dallas Cowboys

reviewText: I have only gone through 2 DVDs, but most of the things I keep seeing are about the entire league and not specifically focused on the Cowboys. Little disappointed.
summary: It's mostly about the NFL season from the Super Bowl years.
Title: NFL Super Bowl Collection - Dallas Cowboys

reviewText: If your a true Cowboy Fan you will love it! This DVD is well done. Go Dallas! It has all of the best plays from the year of each Super Bowl.
Title: NFL Super Bowl Collection - Dallas Cowboys

reviewText: Absolutely love this product. Reminds me of the days before Romo, when there was just Aikman, Irvin, and Emmitt on the field going up and down the field on their opponents. Miss those days! This product is great! It came in on the estimated delivery time and in good condition!
summary: The Glory Days for the Cowboys
Title: NFL Super Bowl Collection - Dallas Cowboys

reviewText: A good collection of the five superbowls that the Dallas Cowboys have won.  These are repeats of the shows by NFL films.
Title: NFL Super Bowl Collection - Dallas Cowboys
